snippet: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar items. Monday’s selections include a suggestion that software could analyze facial expressions and help students learn better, and Microsoft closing...
abstract: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar items. Monday’s selections include a suggestion that software could analyze facial expressions and help students learn better, and Microsoft closing the former WebTV.

headline.main: Today's Scuttlebot: Pulling the Plug on MSN TV, and Computers Guessing Emotions
